terms.definition: A systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards through testing, documentation, and compliance monitoring.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to view revision history and revert to previous versions.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, essential for compliance and accountability.
Detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently and safely within an organization.
A systematic method of identifying the underlying reasons for problems or defects to prevent their recurrence through corrective actions.
A system that stores all organizational documents in a single, accessible location to improve organization, security, and collaboration.
The coordination and automation of business processes, tasks, and document approvals to improve efficiency and ensure consistent execution.
The ability to generate and view current data and analytics instantly as events occur, enabling immediate decision-making and response.
The process of ensuring that an organization adheres to laws, regulations, and industry standards relevant to their business operations.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Software features that enable multiple users to work together on documents, share information, and communicate effectively within a platform.
The assurance that documents remain accurate, complete, and unaltered except through authorized changes, maintaining their reliability over time.
The process of monitoring, evaluating, and ensuring that external vendors and suppliers meet required quality standards and specifications.
A systematic approach to recording, monitoring, and managing product flaws or issues from identification through resolution.
